alert.note: Alert for Bolivar (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 10:28PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Bolivar County through 1100 PM CST... At 1027 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Crumrod, or 12 miles southeast of White River National Wildlife Refuge, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Bolivar County, including the following locations... Duncan and Alligator. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CST for northwestern Mississippi.
